content: {{productName}} will become unavailable during the restore process. After the restore is complete all the changes made after the date of the selected restore point will be lost.

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a warning message indicating that product data will be lost after a restore process. It appears in a settings page, specifically on buttons or links related to data management and backup restoration.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Arabic translation uses a full stop (.) after 'المتاحة', which is grammatically correct but less common in this context. A comma (،) might be more suitable to maintain a more flowing feel, especially given the use of a full stop at the end of the second sentence.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: سيصبح {{productName}} غير متاح، خلال عملية الاستعادة.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, the word 'الاستعادة' (al-isti'aada) can sound a bit formal.  'إستعادة' (istiaada) is more commonly used and might read better. Consider if the formality of 'الاستعادة' aligns with the product's tone.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: سيصبح {{productName}} غير متاح خلال عملية إستعادة. بعد اكتمال إستعادة سيتم فقدان كل التغييرات التي تم القيام بها بعد تاريخ الاستعادة المحدد.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'will become unavailable' is translated as 'yararsız olacaq', which means 'will be unusable' or 'will be worthless'. While close, 'unavailable' implies a temporary state. A more accurate translation might be 'işləyə bilməyəcək' (will not work) or 'tətbiq edilməyəcək' (will not be available).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: işləyə bilməyəcək

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The variable {{productName}} is correctly handled, maintaining the placeholder for dynamic insertion.

The Greek translation uses a full stop (.) at the end of the first sentence and a comma (,) at the end of the second. In Greek, full stops are generally used at the end of both sentences for clarity. Consistent punctuation improves readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace the comma (,) with a full stop (.) at the end of the second sentence: 'Μετά την ολοκλήρωση της επαναφοράς θα χαθούν όλες οι αλλαγές που έγιναν μετά την ημερομηνία του επιλεγμένου σημείου επαναφοράς.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "ei ole pääsyä" (does not have access) is not the most natural way to convey "will become unavailable". A more suitable translation would emphasize the unavailability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: The translation should use a phrase like "ei ole käytössä" (will not be in use) or "on poissa käytöstä" (is out of service).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "häviävät" is technically correct for 'will be lost', it can sound somewhat harsh. A softer phrasing might be more appropriate for a user-facing warning.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using a gentler phrasing like "menetetään" (will be lost) or "poistetaan" (will be removed).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Armenian translation includes a double colon (:) after 'Վերականգնման ավարտից'. This is likely a formatting issue and doesn't align with standard Armenian sentence structure.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the extra colon after 'Վերականգնման ավարտից'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "will become unavailable" is translated as "ຈະບໍ່ສາມາດໃຊ້ໄດ້". While technically correct, a more natural and user-friendly translation might be something like "ຈະບໍ່ສາມາດນຳໃຊ້ໄດ້" or "ຈະບໍ່ສາມາດເຮັດວຽກໄດ້".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ຈະບໍ່ສາມາດນຳໃຊ້ໄດ້

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "all the changes made after the date of the selected restore point will be lost" is translated quite literally and could be simplified for better readability. The word order and flow could be improved.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ການປ່ຽນແປງທັງໝົດທີ່ເຮັດຫຼັງຈາກວັນທີຂອງຈຸດຟື້ນຟູທີ່ເລືອກໄວ້ຈະຖືກລົບອອກ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation maintains the double curly braces `{{productName}}`, which is correct as it's a placeholder. However, ensure consistency in placeholder formatting across all translations.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: No change needed, just confirm consistency.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Polish translation uses "puntu przywracania" which is a masculine form. It should ideally match the gender of the 'restore point' being referred to. Without further context, it's difficult to determine the correct gendered form, but it's worth reviewing to ensure consistency.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Review the gender of 'restore point' and adjust 'puntu przywracania' accordingly. It could potentially be 'punktu przywracania' if it's masculine.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'spațiul {{productName}} va deveni indisponibil' is not a precise translation of '{{productName}} will become unavailable'. 'Spațiul' means 'space' which doesn't quite convey the intended meaning. It should more closely reflect that the application or product itself will be unavailable.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: În timpul procesului de restaurare, {{productName}} va deveni indisponibil.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'crearea unui punct de restaurare' is a bit awkward and literal. While technically correct, it doesn't read naturally in Romanian in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: În timpul procesului de restaurare, toate modificările efectuate după data punctului de restaurare selectat vor fi pierdute.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'will become unavailable' is not accurately translated. 'නොමැවෙනු ඇත' literally means 'will not be present' which isn't the most natural way to convey unavailability in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a translation like 'අතුරුදහන් වනු ඇත' (atarudahananu athaa) which means 'will disappear' or 'will be unavailable'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'After the restore is complete' is somewhat literal. A more natural phrasing might be preferred.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a translation such as 'ප්‍රතිසාධනය අවසානයේ' (prathisaadhanya avasaanaye) which means 'at the end of the restore'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'all the changes made after the date of the selected restore point' could be simplified for clarity.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'ඔබ තෝරාගත් ප්‍රතිසාධන ලක්ෂ්‍යයේ දිනයෙන් පසු සිදු කරන ලද සියලු වෙනස්කම්' (oba thoraagath prathisaadhana lakshyaye dinayen pashu sidu karan lada siyalu venaskam) - 'All changes made after the date of your selected restore point.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'will become unavailable' is not accurately reflected by 'ne bo več na voljo'. A more accurate translation would capture the temporary unavailability during the process.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: It might be more accurate to use something like 'bo nedostopen' which translates to 'will be inaccessible' or 'ne bo dosegljiv' meaning 'will not be accessible'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian translation includes a period after 'обнављања', which is not present in the English original. While grammatically correct, maintaining consistency with the original format is preferable.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the period after 'обнављања'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "在点击“恢复”按钮之后所做的一切修改都作废消失" is a bit awkward and doesn't accurately convey the meaning of "all the changes made after the date of the selected restore point will be lost."  The Chinese implies changes made *after* clicking the 'restore' button, which is misleading. It should reflect changes after the restore point date.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 在选定的恢复点之后所做的所有修改都将丢失 (Zài xuǎndìng de huīfù diǎn zhīhòu suǒ zuò de suǒyǒu xiūgǎi dōu jiāng diūshī).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, the phrasing could be more natural and concise in Chinese. It could potentially be shortened for better readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 在选定的恢复点之后的所有修改都将丢失 (Zài xuǎndìng de huīfù diǎn zhīhòu suǒ zuò de suǒyǒu xiūgǎi dōu jiāng diūshī).
